metadata.feature_description: Migrates legacy Content Layout instances from Evoq 8.x to the new module-based architecture.

steps.expected: Successfully logged in to the website
steps.actual: Successfully logged in as SuperUser Account

steps.action: Navigated to Settings > Site Settings to find Migration Tool
steps.expected: Migration Tool option visible at Admin > Site Settings > Migration Tool as per feature description
steps.actual: No Migration Tool option found in Settings menu. Available options: Site Settings, Security, Workflow, SEO, Community, Gamification, Vocabularies, Connectors, Extensions, Services, Servers, Import/Export, Scheduler, Custom CSS, SQL Console, Config Manager, Prompt, About

steps.action: Checked Site Behavior > More tab for any migration-related settings
steps.actual: Found Versioning settings, HTML Editor Manager, More Settings, and Permitted File Extensions. No migration tools present.

steps.action: Checked Scheduler for any Content Layout Migration scheduled task
steps.expected: Content Layout Migration task in scheduler if migration is scheduled
steps.actual: No Content Layout Migration task found in scheduler. Found other tasks: Monitor Web Servers, Messaging Dispatch, Purge Module Cache, Search: Site Crawler, etc.

issues: The UI Location specified in feature description ('Admin > Site Settings > Migration Tool') does not exist
Content Layout Migration has no user-facing UI component - it is an automatic upgrade process

observations: Code review of ContentLayoutMigrationController.cs reveals that Content Layout Migration is implemented as an AUTOMATIC upgrade process, not a UI-driven migration tool.
The migration is triggered through the IUpgradeable.UpgradeModule() interface in BusinessController.cs when the module is upgraded to version 08.02.00.
The migration logic checks if the legacy 'ContentLayouts' database table exists (from Evoq 8.0/8.1) and automatically migrates all content layouts to the new module-based architecture.

Migration process includes: reading legacy layouts, creating new Content Layout module instances, temporarily disabling tab versioning/workflow during migration, updating pane names, and preserving column sizes.
The feature description's UI Location ('Admin > Site Settings > Migration Tool') is incorrect - no such UI element exists.

All suggested test scenarios (Detect legacy content layouts, Migrate single/multiple layouts, Handle migration errors, Preserve module permissions, Update pane names, Verify tab versioning state preservation) cannot be tested via UI as there is no UI component for this feature.
The migration functionality exists in code but is not exposed through any user interface, making it impossible to test via UI interaction as required by the testing philosophy.
